required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Interleukin 38 as a Biomarker for Metabolic Syndrome in Psoriatic Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Interleukin 38 as a Biomarker for Metabolic Syndrome in Psoriatic Patients

brief_summary.textblock: case control study to compare level of interleukin 38 in patients with psoriasis and patients with metabolic syndrome with healthy control subjects

detailed_description.textblock: this case control study will measure plasma level of interleukin 38 in 4 groups of 24 subject, group one will have psoriatic patients, group 2 will have psoriatic patients with metabolic syndrome, group three will have patients with metabolic syndrome only, and group 4 will have healthy control subjects.

primary_outcome.measure: measure plasma level of interleukin 38 in all groups
primary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion an average of 18 months
primary_outcome.description: level of interleukin 38 will be measured and compared in all groups to asses the relationship between this interleukin and metabolic syndrome in psoriatic patients

arm_group.description: contains 24 psoriatic patients, Psoriasis Area Severity Index will be measured, also waist circumference, body mass index, blood pressure, fasting blood glucose and fasting lipid profile and finally: plasma level of interleukin 38

contains 24 psoriatic patients with metabolic syndrome. Psoriasis Area Severity Index will be measured metabolic syndrome is diagnosed after measuring waist circumference, body mass index, blood pressure, fasting blood glucose and fasting lipid profile finally: plasma level of interleukin 38

contains 24 patients with metabolic syndrome only. full dermatological examination to exclude psoriasis and other inflammatory skin disorders metabolic syndrome is diagnosed after measuring waist circumference, body mass index, blood pressure, fasting blood glucose and fasting lipid profile finally: plasma level of interleukin 38

contains 24 healthy control subjects full dermatological examination to exclude psoriasis and other inflammatory skin disorders metabolic syndrome is excluded after measuring waist circumference, body mass index, blood pressure, fasting blood glucose and fasting lipid profile finally: plasma level of interleukin 38

intervention.intervention_name: measure plasma level of interleukin 38 by ELISA kit
intervention.description: draw 5 ml of venous blood into EDTA tubes and centrifuged then plasma is separated for test

study_pop.textblock: people attending the Dermatology Outpatient Clinics of Sohag University Hospital.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- specific to each group
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patient refusal. Age <18 years Pregnancy Lactation smoking Infections. Patients with other inflammatory skin disorders use of antioxidant and anti-inflammatory drugs patients on treatment for psoriasis

responsible_party.investigator_title: resident doctor in dermatology venereology and andrology department in sohag university hospital
